data.title: ISL 2017-18: Balwant Singh set to join ATK
data.meta_description: The India international is expected to pen a two-year deal with the Kolkata franchise…
data.text:
After having endured a disastrous season in the Indian Super League’s (ISL) fourth edition, ATK are in the process of revamping their squad.

With Pronay Halder and Ricky Lallawmawma already signed for the next season, the Kolkata franchise are close to roping in Balwant Singh.

It is reliably learnt that the 31-year-old, who has six goals from 1362 minutes in the ISL, will sign a two-year deal later this week.

Balwant Singh will join the ‘crorepati’ club as it is believed that the Sourav Ganguly co-owned franchise have offered him a seven figure package per season.

The former JCT striker is one of the decorated players in the Indian football circuit having won the ISL and the I-League. He has also been part of the Federation Cup winning team on three occasions.
